ThingDef.label: red sauerkraut
ThingDef.description:
Sauerkraut is a traditional fermented cabbage dish made by finely shredding fresh cabbage and allowing it to ferment over time. This process creates a tangy, sour flavor, and the cabbage takes on a slightly crisp texture. This recipe calls for red cabbage instead of green.

<color=#E5E54C>Trade considerations:</color>

<color=#E5E54C>Ingredients:</color> Making 10 sauerkraut requires 50 cabbage for a total value of 55, and sells for 13.50, giving a <color=#33CC33>59.26%</color> profit per unit.

<color=#E5E54C>Fermentation time:</color> 20 days.

<color=#E5E54C>Caravan trading:</color> Its weight is 0.1 Kg, for a value per Kg of <color=#33CC33>135</color>.

<color=#E5E54C>Profit per day:</color> On average, profit per day is <color=#33CC33>0.25</color> (for reference, Yayo is 0.35).
